summary: Build a Google Form-style medical registration and medical-team dashboard web app (Bali Medic Care) using the provided React + Firebase code, preserving the existing structure and screens; patient registration is publicly accessible with no login, while the entire medical team must log in (Internet Identity) to access the dashboard and team edit features.
architectural_notes: Keep existing React + Firebase architecture and current view flow (patient-form, dashboard, team-edit, exam-success); changes should be styling/UI only to match Google Forms look and feel.
Access control decision: patient form requires no login; Internet Identity login is required for all medical team members to access dashboard and team management screens.

existing_features.title: Rebuild the application using the Internet Computer stack (Motoko backend + React/TypeScript frontend) while preserving the same user flows, pages, and behavior as in the user-provided React + Firebase script.

Implement a Google Forms-style UI redesign across the patient registration form and related screens (layout, spacing, typography, input styling, section headers, progress/submit affordances) without removing or changing existing form fields/logic from the user-provided script.

Implement Internet Identity authentication for the medical-team dashboard and any admin/team edit functionality, while keeping the patient registration form accessible per the behavior of the user-provided script.

Recreate the medical-team dashboard screens and features from the user-provided script, including listing submissions, viewing details, searching, and filtering by date (and any other existing filters present in the script).
Recreate the export functionality from the user-provided script so authenticated dashboard users can export filtered results (e.g., CSV) from the current dashboard view.

Recreate the medical-team edit/management screen(s) from the user-provided script (e.g., editing team members or clinic/team metadata), persisting changes to the Motoko backend and restricting access to authenticated users.

Implement the patient submission success/confirmation screen(s) from the user-provided script and ensure navigation after submission matches the script (e.g., reset form, show success, redirect behavior).

Apply a coherent visual theme that supports a Google Forms-like aesthetic (neutral whites/grays, clear typographic hierarchy, subtle shadows, consistent spacing) and use it consistently across all screens.
Add generated static brand assets for the app (logo + simple header banner) and render them in the UI as static files served from the frontend (not via the backend).
Ensure the patient registration experience is fully public (no login required) and does not present any patient-facing UI that implies patients must authenticate.
Ensure all medical team areas require Internet Identity login and clearly communicate that authentication is for medical team members only.

new_feature_requests.summary: Update UI to resemble Google Forms while preserving all existing functionality and structure from the provided React + Firebase script

Create Motoko data models and stable persistence for all records currently stored in Firebase in the user-provided script, including the ability to create new patient submissions and read/query them for the dashboard.
